item.title: Blazor Tutorial : GridView Header Filter - EP24
item.description:
Hey Coders,
Subscribe here - https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCetyodKOWGk5H6FoKoFnkZw Talk to us on - https://www.twitch.tv/curiousdrive
Like our page - https://www.facebook.com/curiousdrive/ Follow us on - https://twitter.com/curious_drive Follow us on - https://www.instagram.com/curiousdrive/
Make a donation - https://www.paypal.me/curiousdrive Be a member - https://www.patreon.com/curiousdrive
Find code here... https://github.com/CuriousDrive/BookStores
In this #Blazor tutorial, I am showing how you can add #Filter for your #GridView component.
Content - 1. GridColumn 2. ColumnTitle 3. OnSearchTextChanged 4. ChangeEventArgs 5. GridView
Happy Coding!!!
item.author: (Curious Drive)

item.title: Visual Studio for Mac: Refresh(); event recap | Visual Studio Blog
item.description: We had a great time at the Visual Studio for Mac: Refresh(); event on February 24th! All the videos, slides, and links to demo code are available for you to watch, use for your own virtual events, blog posts, etc. in this repo.
item.author: (Jon GallowaySenior Program Manager, Visual Studio for MacFollow)

item.title: Coding The Road Runner Loop Meme
item.description: There’s a programming meme featuring the Looney Tunes characters of Wile E. Coyote and the Road Runner. These characters are locked in a never-ending chase, where the Coyote seems to come close, but not quite catch the speedy bird. In the meme itself, it shows the Coyote running off of a cliff due to his misuse of the do / while iteration construct, whereas the Road Runner stops short because he presumably used the while iteration construct.
item.author: (Khalid Abuhakmeh)

item.title: The state of the restaurant industry
item.description: As the COVID-19 pandemic keeps people home and some cities, states, and countries limit restaurant operations, our community of nearly 60,000 restaurants faces unprecedented challenges. We’ve summarized the data we have from the restaurants on our platform and are updating it daily.

item.title: ReMarkable’s redesigned e-paper tablet is more powerful and more papery – TechCrunch
item.description: It's no secret I'm a fan of the reMarkable, a tablet with a paper-like display that's focused on text and sketching rather than rich media and games. The sequel to the original, announced today, looks to make a good thing even better.
item.author: (Devin Coldewey@techcrunch / 6:01 am PDT • March 17, 2020comment Comment)

item.title: jsoncsharp 1.0.0.11
item.description: A command line tool to genreate C# classes from json files. These can be example json documents or json schema. In addition, you can also generate a schema from a example json file.

item.title: Windows Terminal Preview v0.10 Release | Windows Command Line
item.description: Welcome to the v0.10 release of the Windows Terminal! As always, you can install the Windows Terminal from the Microsoft Store or download the package from the GitHub releases page. Let’s dive into what’s new! Mouse Input The Terminal now supports mouse input in Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL) applications as well as Windows applications that use virtual terminal (VT) input.
item.author: (Kayla CinnamonProgram Manager, Windows Terminal, Console, Command Line, & Cascadia CodeFollow)

item.title: 10 Examples of CSS Grid - Getting Started
item.description:
CSS Grid is one of the most amazing features to hit CSS in years. You can replace many of the hacks that you used in the past with CSS Grid. In this video, you are going to learn about CSS Grid by creating 10 different examples!
Example 1 - 01:47 Example 2 - 04:45 Example 3 - 07:16 Example 4 - 13:16 Example 5 - 17:55 Example 6 - 22:08 Example 7 - 30:10 Example 8 - 38:26 Example 9 - 41:45 Example 10 - 44:50
References CSS Grid Course by Wes Bos - https://CSSGrid.io/friend/QUICK Complete Guide to CSS Grid - https://css-tricks.com/snippets/css/complete-guide-grid/ Practical CSS Grid by Bryan Robinson - https://www.udemy.com/course/practical-css-grid/
https://www.jamesqquick.com https://www.learnbuildteach.com/

item.author: (Jimmy Bogard)

item.title: Intro to 2D signed distance functions and drawing touch controls with the GPU
item.description: A signed distance function is a function that represents a shape that takes a point as an input and returns the shortest distance to that shape. The sign of the output value determines if the point exists inside the shape or not
